MyOs  0.0.0
MyOs based on Contiki-Os concepts for memory constrained microcontrollers.

35 #include "myos.h"
36 #include <stdlib.h>
37 #include "debug.h"

42 #if DEBUG_PROCESS
43 #define DBG(...) DBG_FUNC(__VA_ARGS__)
44 #define DBG_PROCESS(...) do{DBG("[%d] process: ",(int)timestamp_now());DBG(__VA_ARGS__);}while(0)
45 #else
46 #define DBG(...)
47 #define DBG_PROCESS(...)
48 #endif
49 
50 process_t *process_current = NULL;
51 
52 static plist_t process_running_list;
53 
54 RINGBUFFER_TYPEDEF(process_event_queue,process_event_t,PROCESS_EVENT_QUEUE_SIZE);
55 static RINGBUFFER_T(process_event_queue) process_event_queue;
56 static bool process_global_pollreq = false;
57 
58 
59 
60 void process_init(void)
61 {
62  /* start with an empty process list and an empty event queue */
63  plist_init(&process_running_list);
64  RINGBUFFER_INIT(process_event_queue);
65  PROCESS_THIS() = NULL;
66 }
67 
68 
69 
70 bool process_post(process_t *to, process_event_id_t evtid, void* data)
71 {
72  process_event_t *evt;
73 
74  if( RINGBUFFER_FULL(process_event_queue) )
75  {
76 #if (MYOSCONF_STATS)
77  myos_stats.errflags.eventqueue = 1;
78 #endif
79  return false;
80  }
81 
82  evt = RINGBUFFER_TAIL_PTR(process_event_queue);
83 
84  evt->from = PROCESS_THIS();
85  evt->to = to;
86  evt->id = evtid;
87  evt->data = data;
88 
89  DBG_PROCESS("post from %p to %p evtid=%d ...\n",(void*)evt->from,(void*)evt->to,evt->id);
90  RINGBUFFER_PUSH(process_event_queue);
91 
92 #if (MYOSCONF_STATS)
93  if( RINGBUFFER_COUNT(process_event_queue) > myos_stats.maxqueuecount )
94  {
95  myos_stats.maxqueuecount = RINGBUFFER_COUNT(process_event_queue);
96  }
97 #endif
98 
99  return true;
100 }
101 
102 bool process_deliver_event(process_event_t *evt)
103 {
104  DBG_PROCESS("deliver_event from %p to %p evtid=%d ...\n",(void*)evt->from,(void*)evt->to,evt->id);
105 
106  if ( PROCESS_IS_RUNNING(evt->to) || evt->id == PROCESS_EVENT_START)
107  {
108  PROCESS_CONTEXT_BEGIN(evt->to);
109 
110 #if (MYOSCONF_STATS)
111  rtimer_timespan_t slicetime = rtimer_now();
112 #endif
113 
114  int pstate = PROCESS_THIS()->thread(PROCESS_THIS(),evt);
115 
116 #if (MYOSCONF_STATS)
117  slicetime = rtimer_now() - slicetime;
118 
119  if ( slicetime > PROCESS_THIS()->maxslicetime )
120  {
121  PROCESS_THIS()->maxslicetime = slicetime;
122  }
123 #endif
124 
125  if ( pstate == PT_STATE_TERMINATED )
126  {
127  plist_erase(&process_running_list, PROCESS_THIS());
128  /* broadcast exit to all ? */
129  }
130 
131 
132  PROCESS_CONTEXT_END();
133 
134  return true;
135  }
136 
137  return false;
138 }
139 
140 bool process_post_sync(process_t *to, process_event_id_t evtid, void* data)
141 {
142  process_event_t evt = {
143  .from = PROCESS_THIS(),
144  .to = to,
145  .id = evtid,
146  .data = data
147  };
148 
149  DBG_PROCESS("post_sync from %p to %p evtid=%d ...\n",(void*)evt.from,(void*)evt.to,evt.id);
150  return process_deliver_event(&evt);
151 }
152 
153 bool process_start(process_t *process, void* data)
154 {
155  DBG_PROCESS("start %p ...\n",(void*)process);
156 
157  if( PROCESS_IS_RUNNING(process) )
158  {
159  DBG_PROCESS("start %p failure\n",(void*)process);
160  return false;
161  }
162 
163  process->data = data;
164  PT_INIT(&process->pt);
165  plist_push_front(&process_running_list, process);
166 
167  process_post_sync(process, PROCESS_EVENT_START, data);
168 
169  DBG_PROCESS("start %p success\n",(void*)process);
170 
171  return true;
172 }
173 
174 bool process_exit(process_t *process)
175 {
176  DBG_PROCESS("exit %p ...\n",(void*)process);
177 
178  if( !PROCESS_IS_RUNNING(process) )
179  {
180  DBG_PROCESS("exit %p failure\n",(void*)process);
181  return false;
182  }
183 
184  process_post_sync(process, PROCESS_EVENT_EXIT, NULL); // gets automatically removed from list!
185 
186  DBG_PROCESS("exit %p success\n",(void*)process);
187 
188  return true;
189 }
190 
191 
192 
193 void process_poll(process_t *process)
194 {
195  DBG_PROCESS("polling %p \n",(void*)process);
196  process->pollreq = true;
197  process_global_pollreq = true;
198 }
199 
200 
201 inline int process_run(void)
202 {
203 
204  /* Poll should only be triggered by interrupts. Interrupts always have a higher priority than the main loop context by definition.
205  Thus we first handle all poll requests from interrupts first, before we deliver the next non polling event to a process. */
206 #if (MYOSCONF_STATS)
207  rtimer_timespan_t proctime = rtimer_now();
208 #endif
209 
210  while(process_global_pollreq)
211  {
212  process_t *process;
213 
214  process_global_pollreq = false;
215 
216  plist_foreach(&process_running_list,process)
217  {
218  if( process->pollreq )
219  {
220  process->pollreq = false;
221  process_post_sync(process, PROCESS_EVENT_POLL, NULL);
222  }
223  }
224  }
225 
226 #if (MYOSCONF_PTIMERS)
227  ptimer_processing();
228 #endif
229 
230 
231 
232  if( RINGBUFFER_COUNT(process_event_queue) )
233  {
234  process_deliver_event(RINGBUFFER_HEAD_PTR(process_event_queue));
235  RINGBUFFER_POP(process_event_queue);
236  }
237 
238 
239 #if (MYOSCONF_STATS)
240  proctime = rtimer_now() - proctime;
241 
242  if ( proctime > myos_stats.maxproctime )
243  {
244  myos_stats.maxproctime = proctime;
245  }
246 
247 #endif
248 
249  return RINGBUFFER_COUNT(process_event_queue)+process_global_pollreq;
250 }
